Ricat1998 Augmented Reality (AR) This technology can be reached with multiple methods, for example PokemonGO had augmented reality that uses the gyroscope of the phone to know where to put and animate the pokemons, but in here, they used a camera attached to a machine that does very accurate movements, then they animated the dragon in a way that will fit the way the camera moves (which is hard af.) AND they took into consideration the freaking angle of the sun at that time of the day to properly animate the shadow... Geniuses.

My take on it: They animated the scene, then they had the cameras tell their software live where they are positioned ect. and the whole scene is rendered together live. Look at the frames where the dragon disappears behind the stadium walls (around 10:10) you can see that the dragon is slightly IN the wall. This is because with the technique of rendering onto a real scene with AR, it's difficult to tell when and where exactly real objects are in front of the CGI. They've estimated where the stadium wall would be, but it wasn't 100% correct. This is also the same reason why the people are going away before the dragon landed on the stage, they didn't want something to be in front of the CGI because this would ruin the illusion.
